item.title: HR giant Workday says hackers stole personal data in recent breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The HR tech giant said it had no indication of any unauthorized access to customer systems, but has not ruled out a breach affecting customers' personal information.

item.title: Perplexity now supports live earnings call transcripts for Indian stocks
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: AI startup Perplexity is augmenting its Finance dashboard with the ability to transcribe Indian public companies' quarterly earnings calls live, as well as show schedules for post-results conference calls.

item.title: Grammarly gets a design overhaul, multiple AI features
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Grammarly now has a new document-based interface, built on the back of Coda, the productivity startup it acquired last year. The interface also sports an AI assistant, as well as a few AI tools meant for students and professionals, including an AI grader, proofreader and citation finder.

item.title: GPT-5 is supposed to be nicer now
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: OpenAI announced late Friday that it’s updating its latest model to be “warmer and friendlier.”

item.title: ‘Stranger Things’ creators may be leaving Netflix
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Netflix could soon lose the creative team behind one of its biggest hits, with the Duffer Brothers reportedly signing an exclusive deal with Paramount.

item.title: Duolingo CEO says controversial AI memo was misunderstood
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While Duolingo CEO Luis von Ahn faced backlash after declaring that Duolingo would become an “AI-first company,” he suggested in a new interview the real issue was that he “did not give enough context.”

item.title: Judge says FTC investigation into Media Matters ‘should alarm all Americans’
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: A federal judge has blocked the FTC's investigation into Media Matters research around advertising and antisemitic content on X.

item.title: AI-powered stuffed animals are coming for your kids
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Do A.I. chatbots packaged inside cute-looking plushies offer a viable alternative to screen time for kids? Maybe not.

item.title: Anthropic says some Claude models can now end ‘harmful or abusive’ conversations
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Anthropic says new capabilities allow its latest AI models to protect themselves by ending abusive conversations.

item.title: Winklevoss twins’ crypto company Gemini files for IPO
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Another crypto company is headed for the public markets.

item.title: Sam Altman, over bread rolls, explores life after GPT-5
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: At a dinner with reporters in San Francisco, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman spilled details on the company's ambitions beyond ChatGPT.

item.title: How your solar rooftop became a national security issue
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Texas solar company EG4 became the poster child for home energy cybersecurity risks this week after federal officials published an advisory detailing how hackers could hijack its inverters.

item.title: Sen. Hawley to probe Meta after report finds its AI chatbots flirt with kids
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: “Is there anything - ANYTHING - Big Tech won’t do for a quick buck?” Hawley wrote in a post on X announcing the investigation.

item.title: Les Amis, the European app helping women form friendships, launches in New York
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Les Amis is an app designed to make it easy for women to form friendships and attend local events.

item.title: TikTok’s new guidelines add subtle changes for LIVE creators, AI content, and more
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: TikTok is preparing an update to its Community Guidelines, which dictate the rules for participating on the social video platform as well as what standards the company uses to determine the videos that make it onto its For You feed.

item.title: Kyte, which billed itself as the ‘best competitor to Hertz,’ shuts down
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The startup entered into receivership after selling its customer list to Turo.

item.title: Trump wants to clean up the space industry’s red tape: Here’s who wins
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: A new executive order takes aim at the bureaucracy that the White House says is holding back American competitiveness in space.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
item.dc:creator: Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024.

item.title: Ultrahuman acquires viO HealthTech to launch enhanced cycle and ovulation tracking
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Cycle and Ovulation Pro is available starting Friday as a premium PowerPlug in the Ultrahuman app for $3.99 per month or $39.99 per year for users in the U.S., U.K., EU, Australia, and Canada.

item.title: ChatGPT’s mobile app has generated $2B to date, earns $2.91 per install
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: On average, the app is generating close to $193 million per month, up from $25 million last year.
